units.desc: The sniper carries a Type 97 sniper rifle, which can cause heavy damage to individual units. This unit deals 100 damage to one person in a single attack instead of a flash kill (but still ignores the dodge rate), has a longer attack distance, and moves slowly.

units.name: Gyokusai Assault Squad
units.desc: The soldiers most deeply indoctrinated by militaristic ideology exhibit irrational fanaticism due to their blind and foolish devotion to the emperor, playing a pivotal role in the military as key figures for dealing with troublesome enemies. Before being exposed, they serve as reconnaissance vanguards, biding their time and remaining uncontainable.

units.name: Regiment Rifle Section
units.desc:
The mobilization of troops from different fronts
 of the empire mainly served as the basic land 
branch of the Kwantung Army in the early stage to defend the occupied areas, 
acted as cannon fodder for the inland front, and also had certain logistical capabilities.
 Moderate quality but low growth attributes.

units.name: Regiment Rifleman
units.desc: A basic infantry unit

units.name: Air Assault Raiders
units.desc: The Japanese paratrooper unit was rare and unique. They were parachuted into enemy central points by Mitsubishi transport planes, equivalent to suicide squads, and were completely annihilated in 1942. As a consumable, it occasionally plays a critical role and is ultimately not suitable for participating in frontal combat.

units.name: Field Force
units.desc:
Cavalry armored infantry units commonly seen in the Pacific 
and Asian battlefields often participate in battles with bare 
bodies on coastal battlefields. They are well-trained,
 cruel, and loyal, and can be easily defeated 
by the empire in a one-on-one battle.

units.name: Skull Squadron
units.desc: The Skeleton Squad has excellent equipment and has repeatedly served as the main vanguard of the Japanese army, effectively attacking units with outdated equipment and irregular forces. Their performance in the Battle of Rehe is commendable.

units.name: Type 1 ATGUN
units.desc: The 47mm small caliber anti tank gun is easy to move and install. Unfortunately, the armor piercing ability is poor and there is not much defense, making it easy to suppress, so it can be placed in a sand barrier building.

units.name: Type 41 Infantry Gun
units.desc: A 75mm conventional team curve setup \nwith medium distance high firepower strike capability. \nThe loading speed is fast and the dispersion is average.

units.name: Type 90 ATGUN
units.desc: The Type 90 75mm field gun was developed by the Japanese army based on the Schneider Mle1927 75mm field gun from France. It effectively penetrated medium tanks of average quality such as the M4, but was relatively precious in the military due to its assembly quantity.

units.name: Type 92 Infantry Gun
units.desc: The 70mm caliber howitzer is characterized by being short and agile on the Asian battlefield, with excellent firing rate and range, and fast ballistic flight speed, capable of causing sustained damage to fixed targets such as buildings in the rear of the front line.

units.name: Type 97 AT-Gun
units.desc: Equipped with a 97mm AT-Gun, it can engage in mid-range combat against light armor units.

units.name: Type 94 Infantry Gun
units.desc: Two backup personnel have a certain curve defense capability after installation, but are easily captured by close range attacks.\nThe installation mode can generate sand barriers by sitting in place. Then curve shooting can be performed, and the sand barrier disappears after the frame is retracted. The landing gear time requires 8 frames, and it can still be operated after capture.\nDuring the War of Aggression against China, the commonly used curved positions in land warfare posed a significant threat to the enemy by gathering fire on curved lines. Capable of shooting in a straight line, but has little effect on armored units.

units.name: Type 94 90mm MORTAR
units.desc: A 90mm team sets up mortars, which have no defense capability and can engage in curved confrontation. They can be placed in sand barrier buildings. The diffusion is poor, but the power is still acceptable.

units.name: Type 94 90mm Toxic MORTAR
units.desc: A 90mm team sets up toxic mortars, which have no defense capability and can engage in curved confrontation. They can be placed in sand barrier buildings. The diffusion is poor, but the power is still acceptable.

units.name: Type 97 81mm MORTAR
units.desc: The 81mm team sets up mortars, which have no defense capability and can engage in curved confrontation. They can be placed in sand barrier buildings. The diffusion is poor, but the power is still acceptable.

units.name: Type 94 Auto Truck
units.desc:
A troop transport truck with light defense capability 
can load 5 infantry units for rapid transportation. 
After being destroyed, the unloaded soldiers cannot be 
loaded into the construction team
Can be converted into a resource station, providing fuel and weapon points

units.name: Vickers Armored Car
units.desc:
Equipped with two 7.7mm heavy machine gun turrets, 
the main responsibility is to pursue weak 
targets and annihilate land troops. Effective defense against 
firearm damage, with extremely poor survivability. 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  8mm/8mm/8mm

units.name: Type 1 Half-track
units.desc:
A tracked armored vehicle with light defense capability, 
capable of carrying three infantry units for safe transportation, and 
unloading soldiers after being destroyed can load and set up teams 
(including motorized support infantry) 
(occupying three positions)

units.name: Type 93 Armored Car
units.desc:
Armored vehicles used for early attack and 
surveillance in occupied areas, equipped with one 7.7mm heavy machine gun
 and four 6.5mm light machine guns can effectively defend
 against firearm damage 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  12mm/8mm/8mm

units.name: Type 94 Light Armored Car
units.desc:
Compared to Type 92, 
it has better defense capabilities. 
And it can be modified into a 37mm main gun 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  12mm/8mm/8mm

units.name: Type 95 Command Car
units.desc:
The passenger car is rightfully equipped 
with one colonel level officer among more than 3500, 
stationed in the safe occupied area for command and supervision. 
Without any defensive capability, 
this unit can accommodate a squad of military guards.

The Private Squad within 800 range of this train can 
obtain+10% movement speed and 8 points of armor

units.name: Type 97 Light Armored Car
units.desc:
Equipping 37mm rapid fire guns can pose a threat to light vehicles, 
but as a result, it loses some of its clearance efficiency.
 Defense ability is average 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  25mm/20mm/20mm

units.name: Type 98 Half-track
units.desc:
The Type 38 150mm field howitzer was pulled into the 
front line by an armored vehicle towed by the Type 98 full track artillery.
 It can unload and load artillery, and when the armored vehicle is killed, 
it can spend 8 fuel to summon a new tracked vehicle 
to enter the artillery operation

units.name: Type 2 Amphibious Tank(Float)
units.desc:
This operation can be called up at 
the corners of the map, the vehicle can move on land and sea,
 and is equipped with a 37mm main gun and a 7.7mm machine gun
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  29mm/29mm/29mm

units.name: Type 2 Amphibious Tank
units.desc:
This operation can be called up at 
the corners of the map, the vehicle can move on land and sea,
 and is equipped with a 37mm main gun and a 7.7mm machine gun
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  29mm/29mm/29mm

units.name: Type 92 Heavy Armor Car
units.desc:
The Type 92 tank was developed by the Japanese army in 1932 as a replacement for the Type 90 tank. 
It was equipped with a 13mm machine gun and a 6.5mm machine gun. 
It has a certain ability to resist armor and infantry, but its armor is fragile, but the rear has a large inclined armor. 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  31mm/16mm/16mm

units.name: Type 95 Light Tank
units.desc:
Equipped with 37mm rapid fire guns and 
two Type 97 7.7mm machine guns,
 it can pose a significant threat to light and medium-sized 
vehicle targets and infantry units,
 with high firepower and good maneuverability.
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  29mm/29mm/29mm

units.name: Type 1 Medium Tank
units.desc:
Equipped with 47mm tank gun 
and two 7.7 machine guns
It can pose a threat to light and
 medium-sized vehicle targets and infantry units,
 with average mobility. 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  50mm/25mm/20mm

units.name: Type 3 Medium Tank
units.desc:
Although it is a medium tank, 
it is still positioned as light armor in the Western theater of operations. 
Effectively immune to firearm damage, but lacks effective resistance to penetration. 
As an opposing design against the M4 tank, it is equipped 
with a 75mm main gun that effectively strikes armored units of average light to medium quality. 
It also has a 7.7mm machine gun that 
provides infantry suppression and has been deployed in the Kyushu region.
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  50mm/25mm/20mm

units.name: Type 89-B Medium Tank
units.desc:
Equipped with Type 90 57mm howitzers 
and two 7.7mm machine guns. 
It can provide medium range grenade strikes with a certain anti armor function. 
At the same time, it can provide step strikes
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  16mm/12mm/12mm

units.name: Type 97 Medium Tank (Improved)
units.desc:
Equipped with a 57mm tank gun and two 7.7mm machine guns.
 Effectively dealing with medium-sized vehicles,
 it was one of the largest tanks put into mass production by the Japanese army.
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  25mm/25mm/25mm

units.name: Type 1 Self-Propelled Gun
units.desc:
A light tank destroyer equipped with a 75mm anti tank gun 
and carrying a Type 90 anti tank gun.
 It can only pose a threat to medium tanks from the flank. 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  18mm/10mm/10mm

units.name: Type 4 Self-Propelled Gun
units.desc:
This faction can only produce one unit of this unit,
 and the production will end with a hidden action.
The main gun is a 15cm howitzer, which can pose a threat to all units. 
Armor: Front/Side/Rear  50mm/25mm/25mm
